document.title: Mathematics Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

4DF9D2BBB2E846FE9AF46544A8E7988B.description: Interpret algebraic solutions in context to linear inequalities in one variable.

EB25B2EBB0884AE2929B6CF519691E34.description: Identify a numerical value(s) that is part of the solution set of a given inequality.

30E439EAE6244F4D9E5F6ABF3B0C0011.description:
Solve problems in context that require the solution of a multistep linear inequality in one
variable.

DC154998BE84484AA94D610CABDFBEAD.description: Create a verbal situation in context given a multistep linear inequality in one variable.

2447011BCCC34D8C893D51A21E1B480B.description:
Write multistep linear inequalities in one variable to represent a verbal situation, including
those in context.

82CA81BE477F4E139AF2C97B9E30FD0B.description: Represent solutions to inequalities algebraically and graphically using a number line.

8C88EE361970457484DBEF2A92B0104C.description:
Apply properties of real numbers and properties of inequality to solve multistep linear
inequalities (up to four steps) in one variable with the variable on one or both sides of the
inequality. Coefficients and numeric terms will be rational. Inequalities may contain
expressions that need to be expanded (using the distributive property) or require combining
like terms to solve.

FEFE157600E345E5B4DF7D780302D3AB.description:
The student will write and solve multistep linear inequalities in one variable, including
problems in context that require the solution of a multistep linear inequality in one
variable.

B0B47860146E466FA779AE14F886F8AF.description: Confirm algebraic solutions to linear equations in one variable.

CFCDADA180F343F1BF39457543FE4263.description: Interpret algebraic solutions in context to linear equations in one variable.

EFDB1BA86A2C4C56815223F1A4FA4832.description: Solve problems in context that require the solution of a multistep linear equation.

EAB52F7AE3384BB687791BD52566A8E0.description: Create a verbal situation in context given a multistep linear equation in one variable.

4D962E1510954CF4B7228B428FC58069.description:
Write a multistep linear equation in one variable to represent a verbal situation, including
those in context.

A0AC5C8B41084483A9EF78E6358E6CEF.description:
Apply properties of real numbers and properties of equality to solve multistep linear equations
in one variable (up to four steps). Coefficients and numeric terms will be rational. Equations
may contain expressions that need to be expanded (using the distributive property) or require
combining like terms to solve.

EAE7852A492E49F1990952133EC37E77.description:
Represent and solve multistep linear equations in one variable with the variable on one or
both sides of the equation (up to four steps) using a variety of concrete materials and pictorial
representations.Â

4DB889CF60794D04A53EA5ED123B31A4.description:
The student will write and solve multistep linear equations in one variable, including
problems in context that require the solution of a multistep linear equation in one
variable.

30C241DB181142B191AED87AA2280C42.description: Create a context for a linear function given a graph, table, or equation in the form y = mx + b.

CA273A8299FF4319B189DBA82D0439AA.description:
Write an equation of a linear function in the form y = mx + b, given a graph, table, or a
situation in context.

3347AD35557B489096D63F0843BBF8FE.description:
Create a table of values for a linear function given a graph, equation in the form of y = mx + b,
or context.

CF8242C3D8C449CDA662FDE94F893B9D.description: Graph a linear function given a table, equation, or a situation in context.Â

FF85135CF6A14CDCA564C052A4785C45.description:
Describe key characteristics of linear functions including slope (m), y-intercept (b), and
independent and dependent variables.

B5597069B3F14078836DEC60C07862BE.description:
Determine how adding a constant (b) to the equation of a proportional relationship y = mx will
translate the line on a graph.Â

9E71A4CC64CC48FCB5E45EAE0DBE5774.description:
The student will represent and solve problems, including those in context, by using
linear functions and analyzing their key characteristics (the value of the y-intercept
(b) and the coordinates of the ordered pairs in graphs will be limited to integers).

F18B2F76BEAE4FF0BCE233B0D504E69B.description:
Identify the domain and range of a function represented as a set of ordered pairs, a table, or a
graph of discrete points.Â

149AD340A0294D66957771355D33DD94.description:
Determine whether a relation, represented by a set of ordered pairs, a table, or a graph of
discrete points is a function. Sets are limited to no more than 10 ordered pairs.Â

DBF8B20859264A35B6B3EA4B5B6FE318.description:
The student will determine whether a given relation is a function and determine the
domain and range of a function.Â

F81D0AE36EA440D8B9A0B762D4E2B6D2.description:
Simplify and generate equivalent algebraic expressions in one variable by applying the order
of operations and properties of real numbers. Expressions may need to be expanded (using the
distributive property) or require combining like terms to simplify. Expressions will include
only linear and numeric terms. Coefficients and numeric terms may be rational.

6ACF243E307042138FC1F09FCC545C2D.description:
Represent algebraic expressions using concrete manipulatives or pictorial representations
(e.g., colored chips, algebra tiles), including expressions that apply the distributive property.Â

8CBAC4F01835401D967A37674B1723A7.description:
The student will represent, simplify, and generate equivalent algebraic expressions in
one variable.Â

D29C91F23E9A439CA46A11923CB1DF7B.description: Sketch the line of best fit for data represented in a scatterplot.

2EBE1C3418EA4095994E32F30D3D3FE6.description:
Analyze and justify the relationship of the quantitative bivariate data represented in
scatterplots.Â

2AC6E6395BBF453AAAA2C06036660ACB.description:
Make observations about a set of data points in a scatterplot as having a positive linear
relationship, a negative linear relationship, or no relationshipÂ

F03C80E4F5DF43189591FE6AB708BA0C.description:
Organize and represent numeric bivariate data using scatterplots with and without the use of
technology.

7D56A67CD980485994ECBBE2E006C71B.description:
Determine the data needed to answer a formulated question and collect the data (or acquire
existing data) of no more than 20 items using various methods (e.g., observations,
measurement, surveys, experiments).

6B5DE0352E0F4B1BB8EB548604AEA0C7.description:
Formulate questions that require the collection or acquisition of data with a focus on
scatterplots.

8D1D022DA83E452496D46167A7CDDAB9.description: Identify components of graphical displays that can be misleading.Â

EE1B09F9856646EA918DCBCE3798860A.description:
Given a contextual situation, justify which graphical representation (e.g., pictographs, bar
graphs, line graphs, line plots/dot plots, stem-and-leaf plots, circle graphs, histograms, and
boxplots) best represents the data.Â

C01C6F5A40214E86BA686534F4173273.description: Compare and analyze two data sets represented in boxplots.Â

0465C956D00F4CB88B24800D08F5D30F.description: Analyze data represented in a boxplot by making observations and drawing conclusions.

CC1206C297D64CD8AE513DC47677C37B.description:
Describe how the presence of an extreme data point (outlier) affects the shape and spread of
the data distribution of a boxplot.

75D82827F2F54E448255087D61B1B346.description:
Identify and describe the lower extreme (minimum), upper extreme (maximum), median,
upper quartile, lower quartile, range, and interquartile range given a data set, represented by a
boxplot.

38B7438970104452AA19B314DA641D83.description:
Organize and represent a numeric data set of no more than 20 items, using boxplots, with and
without the use of technology.

76826BC3D1B447B8BFF3B4361AC6E5A4.description:
Determine how statistical bias might affect whether the data collected from the sample is
representative of the larger population.

CE2B621A242C4089BD94BAF457B952B0.description:
Determine the data needed to answer a formulated question and collect the data (or acquire
existing data) using various methods (e.g., observations, measurement, surveys, experiments).

71B0130A3420455D99F3937DDA5FF0E5.description: Formulate questions that require the collection or acquisition of data with a focus on boxplots.

AD08E3993E5041C3867AF727740092CF.description: Determine the probability of two dependent events.Â

FAF1551F692C4AE8B52646BA1F30A768.description: Determine the probability of two independent events.Â

EC06B343EFBC443F9572ACC666F0260B.description: Compare and contrast the probability of independent and dependent events.Â

48ACF78C21D04D8C86ED08632B84C8B7.description:
Determine whether two events are independent or dependent and explain how replacement
impacts the probability.Â

EF882C93B29C4E3E9E22DCC4014AAA8D.description:
The student will use statistical investigation to determine the probability of independent
and dependent events, including those in context.

4C80847CF6774A7AA298C28CEA39C066.description:
Apply perimeter, circumference, and area formulas to solve contextual problems involving
composite plane figures.

4E5887A8EEF14695A01D30C948655DC0.description:
Subdivide a plane figure into triangles, rectangles, squares, trapezoids, parallelograms, and
semicircles. Use the attributes of the subdivisions to determine the perimeter of the composite
plane figure.

1ED78E6D5D064A00A6279A05C46FF2FA.description:
Subdivide a plane figure into triangles, rectangles, squares, trapezoids, parallelograms, circles,
and semicircles. Determine the area of subdivisions and combine to determine the area of the
composite plane figure.

FB07D15A804343358A3E6224A028AFA3.description:
The student will solve area and perimeter problems involving composite plane figures,
including those in context.Â

927303E4F98944BAB1F940CCA4957DB3.description:
Apply the Pythagorean Theorem, and its converse, to solve problems involving right triangles
in context.

4BD48F92CE304001B8CAD5BBBF3F7CA6.description: Determine the measure of a side of a right triangle, given the measures of the other two sides.

9706EDB860BB4704A3E7FBFB4BEB940C.description:
Identify the parts of a right triangle (the hypotenuse and the legs) given figures in various
orientations.

B49A14274B0B40979C021272379B50C6.description: Determine whether a triangle is a right triangle given the measures of its three sides.

A8D2DD53E27B40729B7DFD2644F21551.description: Verify the Pythagorean Theorem using diagrams, concrete materials, and measurement.

FFD945758A6940ED9516DD1E3E6C1E46.description:
The student will apply the Pythagorean Theorem to solve problems involving right
triangles, including those in context.

A1C49430E4944D9A8C1B8F178BF0368D.description: Identify and describe transformations in context (e.g., tiling, fabric, wallpaper designs, art).

C72D2D0124DE460087FA97B9069D33D5.description:
Sketch the image of a polygon that has been translated and reflected over the x- or y-axis, or
reflected over the x- or y-axis and then translated.Â

30B26C65DAA341E4A9AC1038167420D8.description: Sketch the image of a polygon that has been reflected over the x- or y-axis.

3009FB5013194705BDB936CABF9443AD.description:
Sketch the image of a polygon that has been translated vertically, horizontally, or a
combination of both.Â

06D5456CAA7D4700BDA58839D6CF12E8.description:
Given a preimage in the coordinate plane, identify the coordinates of the image of a polygon
that has been translated and reflected over the x- or y-axis or reflected over the x- or y-axis
and then translated.Â

46E3B6168A6A4D178077D2C2789BF11B.description:
Given a preimage in the coordinate plane, identify the coordinates of the image of a polygon
that has been reflected over the x- or y-axisÂ

00CEEC289CCF4C6B95F71A64E7CF644C.description:
Given a preimage in the coordinate plane, identify the coordinates of the image of a polygon
that has been translated vertically, horizontally, or a combination of both.

9C9385E22B5746D1B6CD963BF17C333E.description: The student will apply translations and reflections to polygons in the coordinate plane.

126B324853DE435F98FCBFC54299765E.description:
Solve problems in context involving volume of cones and square-based pyramids and the
surface area of square-based pyramids.

DD657487F3424E65BDEE8D83FC3207AF.description:
Examine and explain the relationship between the volume of cones and cylinders, and the
volume of rectangular prisms and square based pyramids.

4E4C358F286B48158FB8C83C9C8315A9.description:
Determine the volume of cones and square-based pyramids, using concrete objects, diagrams,
and formulas.

43F5A3E3499442FC80AC88C78EB5B0C9.description:
Determine the surface area of square-based pyramids by using concrete objects, nets,
diagrams, and formulas.Â

C2C5B68A332D4200B0C64A0F78054F7F.description:
The student will investigate and determine the surface area of square-based pyramids
and the volume of cones and square-based pyramids.

D0FE420C7DF34AA1982CF59A689BDF3A.description:
Use the relationships among supplementary, complementary, vertical, and adjacent angles to
solve problems, including those in context, involving the measure of unknown angles.

F6E2F1B0009C4C1995106E8270D260B8.description:
Identify and describe the relationship between pairs of angles that are vertical, adjacent,
supplementary, and complementary.

BE12B57E63F54414A4D925FDEE058171.description:
The student will use the relationships among pairs of angles that are vertical angles,
adjacent angles, supplementary angles, and complementary angles to determine the
measure of unknown angles.Â

ED80FDCA4F624736A5566BC10C983F2D.description:
Estimate and solve contextual problems that require the computation of the percent increase
or decrease.

DFF77287B69642FFA9603997C0BC4F59.description:
Estimate and solve contextual problems that require the computation of the sales tax, tip and
resulting total.

36A6822FDACA47FE8E38AE2C41AAAEE4.description:
Estimate and solve contextual problems that require the computation of one discount or
markup and the resulting sale price.

3FDBCC9943374C648053ACC0308C05D3.description:
The student will estimate and apply proportional reasoning and computational
procedures to solve contextual problems.

E9A9531A2F2B496287146FBF89A2F958.description: Describe each subset of the set of real numbers and include examples and non-examples.

22A44F387EB040CAB90C1BE5D7BAAE70.description:
Classify and explain why a given number is a member of a particular subset or subsets of the
real number system.

B0E70DD7A2034420B56C9FDFAA7C076A.description:
Describe and illustrate the relationships among the subsets of the real number system by using
representations (e.g., graphic organizers, number lines). Subsets include rational numbers,
irrational numbers, integers, whole numbers, and natural numbers.

F0FC2DBA4446476F9F3FD73D3D8C29F7.description: Students will demonstrate the following Knowledge and Skills:

111E42AA645C47E489CDDC298F7E7E4A.description:
The student will investigate and describe the relationship between the subsets of the
real number system.

904945E6EEEE42D08B9854FC396DE217.description:
Use multiple strategies (e.g., benchmarks, number line, equivalency) to compare and order no
more than five real numbers expressed as integers, fractions (proper or improper), decimals,
mixed numbers, percents, numbers written in scientific notation, radicals, and Ï. Radicals mayÂ include both positive and negative square roots of values from 0 to 400. Ordering may be in
ascending or descending order. Justify solutions orally, in writing or with a model.

FF7D3FBF89CC48FF9B99D53A2D3AEA2C.description:
Use rational approximations (to the nearest hundredth) of irrational numbers to compare,
order, and locate values on a number line. Radicals may include both positive and negative
square roots of values from 0 to 400 yielding an irrational number.Â

FCE4C80F9DE24D9599B2C75E8BFF24C7.description:
Estimate and identify the two consecutive natural numbers between which the positive square
root of a given number lies and justify which natural number is the better approximation.
Numbers are limited to natural numbers from 1 to 400.

3EEA4B6313F44DE88E574606D46064F9.description:
The student will compare and order real numbers and determine the relationships
between real numbers.
